derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'clear of dregs, purify'): from Latin defaecat- 'cleared of dregs', from the verb defaecare, from de- (expressing removal) + faex, faec- 'dregs'. The current sense dates from the mid 19th cent

entry.def: When people and animals defecate, they get rid of waste matter from their body through their anus.
